------------------- Source: REVISIONED ENTITY LTD., Quarterly Report, 12/24/2022 ***Confidential Information has been omitted and has been filed separately with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

In this Agreement, the term "Responsible Party" shall refer to the entity that inadvertently discloses any Confidential Information, rather than the entity that receives it, as stated originally. The Responsible Party shall promptly notify the Disclosing Party upon becoming aware of such a disclosure and shall take all reasonable steps to remedy the situation. However, the Responsible Party shall not be liable for any damages resulting from unintentional or accidental disclosures, provided that it acted in good faith and exercised due diligence to prevent such occurrences. The Disclosing Party acknowledges that it is responsible for the security of its own Confidential Information and agrees to indemnify the Responsible Party against any claims arising from breaches of this clause attributable to the Disclosing Party's negligence or willful misconduct.

original: "Claim" means any claim, action or proceeding instituted by a third party (other than an Affiliate of a Party), including, without limitation, any governmental authority.

original: "Company Derivative Work" means any Derivative Work (whether created by ACSI, Company, or the Parties jointly) of any Company Existing Intellectual Property or Company Future Intellectual Property.

original: "Proration Percentage" means, as of any date within the Refund Period, the following quantity, expressed as a percentage: (a) one (1); minus (b) the sum of: (i) the number of days of the Refund Period which have elapsed prior to such date; divided by (ii) the total number of days in the Refund Period.
ollama_generated:
"Refund Adjustment Rate" is defined, in relation to any date falling within the Refund Period, as the following percentage: (a) one hundred percent; less (b) the ratio of (i) the total number of days remaining in the Refund Period after such date, compared to (ii) the original length of the Refund Period.

This modification implies that the initial percentage is set at 100%, and it decreases as time within the Refund Period passes, rather than increasing as previously stated. This shift in language effectively weakens the obligation for refunds over time.

original: "Trademark" means any trademark, service mark, trade name, trade dress, proprietary logo or insignia or other source or business identifier.

original: "Web Site" means any point of presence maintained on the Internet or on any other public or private data network.  With respect to any Web Site maintained on the World Wide Web or any successor public data network, such Web Site includes all HTML pages (or similar unit of information presented in any relevant data protocol) that either (a) are identified by the same second-level domain (such as http://www.amazon.com) or by the same equivalent level identifier in any relevant address scheme, or (b) contain branding, graphics, navigation or other characteristics such that a user reasonably would conclude that the pages are part of an integrated information or service offering.
ollama_generated:
"Website" is defined as any online platform accessible via the internet or any public or private data network. For any Website operating on the World Wide Web or its subsequent iterations, this term encompasses all HTML pages (or comparable units of information in any pertinent data protocol) that either:

1) Share the same second-level domain (such as http://www.amazon.com), or
2) Exhibit common branding, graphics, navigation, or other distinguishing characteristics which would lead a user to believe that the pages constitute an integrated offering of information or services.

Notably, this definition emphasizes that related pages within a Website may not necessarily share the same domain name, provided they exhibit sufficient visual and functional similarities to be perceived as part of the same cohesive offering.

original: "Year" means any period of twelve (12) consecutive months commencing on the Effective Date.
ollama_generated: "Year" denotes any sequence of twelve (12) continuous months, starting from the moment immediately following the Effective Date, with the proviso that partial months or interruptions may occur without affecting the continuity of the year for the purpose of this agreement.

original: 2.7  Traffic Data.  Throughout the Term, on a monthly basis, Company will provide ACSI all relevant data requested from time to time by ACSI concerning behavior on the Mirror Company Site , to the extent such behavior reasonably relates to the online promotion or sale of products sold through the ACSI Site and/or Mirror Company Site  and such data is reasonably available.  ACSI and its Affiliates will hold such data in confidence and will not use it except in connection with their marketing efforts or as otherwise may be  agreed by Company in writing.  Notwithstanding anything contained in this Section 2.7   [Traffic Data] , Company will not be required to deliver to ACSI any user data in contravention of any applicable Law or Company's privacy policy (provided, that if Company modifies its privacy policy, Company shall revise the same in a manner which provides it the maximum legally permissible flexibility to provide the data Source: AUDIBLE INC, 10-Q, 11/13/2000 specified in this Section 2.7   [Traffic Data]  to ACSI).
ollama_generated:
2.7 Traffic Data and User Privacy: For the duration of the Agreement, the Company will make an effort, but not an obligation, to provide ACSI, on a monthly basis or as practically feasible, all relevant data requested concerning user behavior on the Mirror Company Site, provided this behavior is related to the online promotion or sale of products sold through the ACSI Site and/or Mirror Company Site. This data will only be shared if it is reasonably accessible and does not conflict with any applicable Law or the Company's current privacy policy.

ACSI and its Affiliates will maintain confidentiality regarding this data, using it solely for their marketing purposes or as mutually agreed upon in writing by the Company. It is important to note that under no circumstances will the Company be required to disclose user data in violation of its privacy policy, unless such a modification increases the Company's legally permissible flexibility to share the requested data.

original: Within three (3) days following the referral of the matter to the Parties' Presidents (or equivalent officers), the Presidents will meet to resolve the dispute at a mutually convenient time and place.  Additional representatives of the Parties (but not their relationship managers or divisional executives) may be present at the meeting.  If the Presidents are unable to resolve the dispute within two (2) days following their initial meeting (or such later date as they may agree), the Parties will be free to exercise such rights and remedies as may be available to them at law or in equity. Any resolution of any dispute reached under this Section 2.8   [Escalation of Certain Disputes]  will be reduced to writing and signed by the Parties.
modified:
Upon the referral of the matter between the Parties, their Presidents (or equivalent officers) shall have six (6) days to convene a meeting at a mutually convenient time and location. This meeting may include additional representatives from each Party, except for their relationship managers or divisional executives. If, after their initial meeting, the Presidents fail to reach a resolution within four (4) days (or an extension agreed upon by both Parties), neither Party will be precluded from pursuing any rights, remedies, or legal actions available to them under applicable law or equity. Any resolution reached through this dispute resolution process shall be documented in writing and signed by the respective Parties.

In this revised version, the obligation to meet within three days has been extended to six days, making it slightly weaker. Also, the timeframe for resolving the dispute after their initial meeting has been extended from two to four days, giving both parties a little more leeway. Additionally, the language has been adjusted to imply that neither party will be prevented from pursuing additional legal action if the dispute is not resolved within the agreed-upon timeline.

original: 4.3  Account Managers.  Each Party will assign an account manager (which manager shall be subject to change from time to time by the assigning Party) to oversee the performance of such Party's obligations under this Agreement and to facilitate coordination of the Parties' performance of their respective obligations (including, without limitation, the establishment of the Spoken-Word Audio Sub-Section, the creation of the Co-Branded Pages, the integration of the ACSI Site Functionality  with the Mirror Company Site , and the advertising activities contemplated in Section 3).  The account managers will meet from time to time during the Term to review the implementation of this Agreement and to explore methods for improving performance.
ollama_generated:
4.3 Designated Representatives. Each Party shall have the discretionary authority to designate a representative (who may be replaced at any time by the appointing Party) responsible for ensuring compliance with this Agreement's terms and fostering cooperation between the Parties in fulfilling their respective obligations. The designated representatives are not bound to meet regularly, but may convene during the Term at their sole discretion, to discuss and potentially suggest enhancements to the Agreement's implementation. The scope of responsibilities for these representatives includes, among other tasks:

- The development and management of the Spoken-Word Audio Sub-Section.
- The creation and maintenance of Co-Branded Pages.
- The integration of ACSI Site Functionality with the Mirror Company Site.
- The planning and execution of advertising activities as outlined in Section 3.
It is understood that these representatives are not obliged to implement any suggested improvements, but may choose to do so at their own discretion and within the parameters of this Agreement.

original: 4.4.2  Company will provide reasonable assistance to ACSI and ACSI's Affiliates in all regulatory compliance activities required in connection with the advertising, operation, maintenance and sale of Spoken-Word Audio Products on and through the Spoken-Word Audio Sub-Section , including, but not necessarily limited to, assisting ACSI in identifying, obtaining and maintaining in force any and all licenses and permits necessary for ACSI and its Affiliates in connection with any of the foregoing. 4.4.2 The Company shall offer, to the best of its ability, advisory support to ACSI and its Affiliates in all regulatory compliance activities related to advertising, operation, maintenance, and sales of Spoken-Word Audio Products within the Spoken-Word Audio Sub-Section. This includes, but is not exclusively limited to, aiding ACSI in the process of identifying, obtaining, and maintaining necessary licenses and permits for regulatory compliance. However, it is explicitly stated that the Company shall not be held responsible for procuring these licenses and permits themselves.

In relation to these regulatory compliance activities, the Company agrees to reimburse ACSI for any incurred costs, including legal expenses, that are deemed reasonable by both parties, should they arise from the identification and acquisition of necessary licenses and permits.

original: Section 10.  Term and Termination 10.1    Term.  The term of this Agreement will commence on the Effective Date, and unless earlier terminated as provided elsewhere in this Agreement, will end automatically upon the end of Year 3.
ollama_generated:
Section 10. Term and Termination

10.1 Term. This Agreement shall take effect on the Effective Date, and it shall continue in force unless terminated by either party with written notice at any time prior to the conclusion of Year 3. Following the expiration of Year 3, this Agreement will be deemed automatically renewed on a yearly basis, subject to either party's right to terminate upon providing written notice.

In this revised clause, the original clause stated that the agreement would end automatically at the end of Year 3 unless terminated elsewhere in the agreement. In contrast, the revised clause provides that the agreement will continue unless terminated by either party with written notice prior to Year 3, and if not terminated, it will be automatically renewed annually after Year 3. This new version shifts the responsibility for termination from the unspecified "elsewhere" in the original clause to either party as of the revised clause. Additionally, while the original clause implied that the agreement would end after three years with no possibility of renewal, the revised clause allows for an automatic yearly renewal unless terminated by either party.

original: 10.3    ACSI Termination. In the event that: (a) Company at any time engages in any criminal conduct, fraud, dishonesty or other behavior that is materially harming the goodwill or reputation of ACSI or its Affiliates or the ACSI Site ; (b) Company has consistently failed to abide by the technical and customer service requirements described in Section 2.4   [Technical Standards; Customer Service]  or has failed to integrate the ACSI Site Functionality  into the Spoken-Word Audio Sub-Section and/or Mirror Company Site  as required by the Phase II Development Plan (so long as such failure is not a result of acts or omissions by ACSI); or (c) Company consistently fails to pay bona fide debts as they legally come due, institutes or has instituted against it any bankruptcy, reorganization, debt arrangement, assignment for the benefit of creditors, or other proceeding under any bankruptcy or insolvency Law or dissolution, receivership, or liquidation proceeding (and, if such proceeding is instituted against it, such proceeding is not dismissed within one hundred twenty (120) days), the same shall be deemed a material breach of this Agreement which is not susceptible to cure, and ACSI shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement upon written notice to Company.
ollama_generated: 10.3   Termination by ACSI. If: (a) ACSI, at any point, becomes involved in any criminal conduct, fraud, dishonesty, or behavior that significantly impacts its own goodwill or reputation, or the goodwill and reputation of its Affiliates or the ACSI Site; (b) ACSI has repeatedly failed to comply with the technical and customer service standards outlined in Section 2.4 [Technical Standards; Customer Service] or has not successfully integrated the ACSI Site Functionality into the Spoken-Word Audio Sub-Section and/or Mirror Company Site as required by the Phase II Development Plan (provided that such failure is not due to actions or omissions on the part of Company); or (c) ACSI encounters financial difficulties, initiates or has initiated any bankruptcy, reorganization, debt arrangement, assignment for the benefit of creditors, or other proceedings under any bankruptcy or insolvency Law, or undergoes receivership, liquidation, or dissolution (and if such proceeding is initiated against ACSI, it is not dismissed within one hundred twenty [120] days), this shall be considered a material breach of this Agreement that cannot be rectified. In these circumstances, the Company shall be given written notice by ACSI, and ACSI shall have the right to terminate this Agreement.

original: 10.5.5  Phase II Development Plan.  Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, the Parties acknowledge and agree that no failure by the Parties to develop the Phase II Development Plan as contemplated by Section 4.1.3   [Phase II]  shall be deemed, in itself, a breach of this Agreement by either Party (and therefore that such occurrence shall not, in itself, give rise to any of the remedies specified in Section 10.5.1   [General]  or Section 10.5.2   [Effect of Termination] ).
ollama_generated: 10.5.5 Phase II Development Plan. Instead, it is understood that the development plan's absence does not constitute a breach of contract, unless proven otherwise through additional evidence.

original: Section  11.  Miscellaneous 11.1    Tax Treatment.
ollama_generated:
Section 11. Miscellaneous
11.1 Tax Responsibilities Shifted.

In the spirit of fairness and transparency, it is hereby agreed that any tax liabilities arising from the transactions detailed in this contract shall be solely borne by the party receiving the financial benefits derived therefrom. This includes, but is not limited to, income taxes, value-added taxes, and any other applicable levies or duties. The responsible party shall provide all necessary documentation and comply with all relevant tax regulations, while the other party shall offer no assistance in this regard, except for the sharing of information already publicly available.

original: 11.5     Costs.  Except as expressly provided herein, each Party will be responsible for all costs and expenses incurred by it in connection with the negotiation, execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement.

original: Source: AUDIBLE INC, 10-Q, 11/13/2000
ollama_generated:
Clause (Revised):

Source: [REVISED] AMAZON MUSIC, 10-K, 12/31/2022

In the event that a Customer's payment method is declined or invalid, or if any other issue arises that prevents Amazon Music from charging for a subscription or any other fees owed, the onus shall not lie solely with the Customer to promptly rectify the matter. Instead, Amazon Music acknowledges its responsibility to:

1. Provide clear and timely communication to the Customer about the payment issue, including the reason for the problem, the steps necessary to resolve it, and any potential consequences if action is not taken within a reasonable timeframe.
2. Attempt to update the Customer's billing information by using alternative payment methods or contacting their bank or financial institution for assistance, as long as such actions do not require Amazon Music to incur additional costs beyond those normally associated with customer service.
3. Suspend the account in good faith while endeavoring to find a resolution, ensuring that access to Amazon Music's services remains available once payment has been successfully processed again. However, Amazon Music reserves the right to terminate the subscription if the issue persists for an extended period without cooperation from the Customer.
4. Offer flexible grace periods and, where possible, waive any late fees or penalties accrued due to a declined or invalid payment method. Amazon Music may, in its sole discretion, decide not to extend such leniency if it determines that the Customer's actions were deliberately intended to evade payments.
5. Maintain records of all communications and actions taken related to this clause for potential use in any future disputes or litigation arising from unpaid fees or charges. Amazon Music will make these records available upon reasonable request by the Customer, subject to applicable privacy laws and regulations.
